UUPS upgradeable pattern and hedge management","events":{"AdminChanged(address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when the admin account has changed."},"Approval(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance."},"BeaconUpgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the beacon is changed."},"Initialized(uint8)":{"details":"Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized."},"Paused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`."},"Transfer(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero."},"Unpaused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`."},"Upgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the implementation is upgraded."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"accrueMarginFees()":{"details":"Controller only, called periodically"},"adjustHedge(uint256)":{"details":"Controller only, use with caution","params":{"targetDeltaETH":"Target ETH delta to hedge (1e18)"}},"allowance(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-allowance}."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"deposit(uint256)":{"details":"Initiates 2-step process (queues deposit)","params":{"assets":"Amount of USDC to deposit"}},"depositExecute((address,bytes,uint256)[])":{"params":{"swapCalls":"Array of swaps to execute before deployment"}},"depositRegister(uint256)":{"details":"Wraps deposit()"},"emergencyExit()":{"details":"Owner only, irreversible"},"getCurrentAMM()":{"details":"For strategy-based vaults, returns data derived from strategy balances"},"getImplementation()":{"returns":{"_0":"Implementation address"}},"getPendingStates()":{"details":"Returns the first pending operation found (simplified for interface compliance)"},"getVaultEquity()":{"details":"Must be implemented by child to correctly calculate value from balances"},"harvest()":{"details":"Controller only","returns":{"fees0":"Fees collected in token0","fees1":"Fees collected in token1"}},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"rebalanceAMM()":{"details":"Controller only"},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"setController(address)":{"params":{"_controller":"New controller address"}},"setHedgeAdapter(address)":{"params":{"_adapter":"Hedge adapter address"}},"setMaxTotalAssets(uint256)":{"params":{"_maxTotalAssets":"New max TVL"}},"setMinDeposit(uint256)":{"params":{"_minDeposit":"New minimum deposit"}},"setPaused(bool)":{"params":{"_paused":"True to pause, false to unpause"}},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC20-totalSupply}."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`."},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"upgradeTo(address)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event."},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event."},"withdraw(uint256)":{"details":"Initiates 2-step process (queues withdrawal). Uses shares input?  The user said \"withdraw(amount) ... to avoid confusion\".  If AnalogVault uses amount (USDC), we should probably use amount (USDC) and calculate shares. However, Standard is withdraw(assets), redeem(shares). AnalogVault withdraw(uint256 usdcAmount). Let's accept usdcAmount."},"withdrawExecute((address,bytes,uint256)[],uint256)":{"params":{"swapCalls":"Array of swaps to execute after withdrawal (e.g. WETH -> USDC)"}},"withdrawRegister(uint256,address)":{"details":"Wraps withdraw()"}},"title":"BaseHedgedVault","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"accrueMarginFees()":{"notice":"Accrue margin fees for open hedge"},"adjustHedge(uint256)":{"notice":"Manually adjust hedge position"},"approveSwaps()":{"notice":"Approve router for swaps (manual override)"},"balances()":{"notice":"Get underlying balances of the AMM/Strategy"},"calculateAMMDelta()":{"notice":"Calculate current ETH delta from AMM position"},"controller()":{"notice":"Get controller address"},"deposit(uint256)":{"notice":"Register a deposit of USDC"},"depositCancel()":{"notice":"Cancel pending deposit"},"depositExecute((address,bytes,uint256)[])":{"notice":"Execute pending deposit (step 2 of 2, controller only)"},"depositRegister(uint256)":{"notice":"Legacy deposit register function"},"emergencyExit()":{"notice":"Emergency exit - close all positions and return to USDC"},"emergencyExitTriggered()":{"notice":"Check if emergency exit was triggered"},"getCurrentAMM()":{"notice":"Get current AMM position details"},"getCurrentHedge()":{"notice":"Get current hedge cap)"},"minDeposit()":{"notice":"Get minimum deposit amount"},"rebalanceAMM()":{"notice":"Rebalance AMM position when out of range"},"setController(address)":{"notice":"Update controller DgBLbaJ"]},"src/libraries/SwapExecutor.sol":{"keccak256":"0x1cb7fc7384ba601ba288b68bc05b621984ddb78557e86bcfd07777f4490bd556","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://7cb47266b24304064ab48aa4464ab4ed7191c7002cdb3b9c8774d1535cabfdf0","dweb:/ipfs/QmeN3GZ81kTrsQ6vtGhnw5UuZt6hJabD5bwN4G5DgiXvuX"]}},"version":1}

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

params.swapCalls: Array of swaps to execute before deployment

getCurrentAMM().details: For strategy-based vaults, returns data derived from strategy balances

getPendingStates().details: Returns the first pending operation found (simplified for interface compliance)

getVaultEquity().details: Must be implemented by child to correctly calculate value from balances

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._paused: True to pause, false to unpause

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

withdraw(uint256).details: Initiates 2-step process (queues withdrawal). Uses shares input?  The user said "withdraw(amount) ... to avoid confusion".  If AnalogVault uses amount (USDC), we should probably use amount (USDC) and calculate shares. However, Standard is withdraw(assets), redeem(shares). AnalogVault withdraw(uint256 usdcAmount). Let's accept usdcAmount.

params.swapCalls: Array of swaps to execute after withdrawal (e.g. WETH -> USDC)

accrueMarginFees().notice: Accrue margin fees for open hedge

balances().notice: Get underlying balances of the AMM/Strategy

calculateAMMDelta().notice: Calculate current ETH delta from AMM position

depositExecute((address,bytes,uint256)[].notice: Execute pending deposit (step 2 of 2, controller only)

emergencyExit().notice: Emergency exit - close all positions and return to USDC

emergencyExitTriggered().notice: Check if emergency exit was triggered

getVaultEquity().notice: Get total equity of the vault in USDC terms

rebalanceAMM().notice: Rebalance AMM position when out of range

withdrawExecute((address,bytes,uint256)[.notice: Execute pending withdrawal (step 2 of 2, controller only)
